The Section 179 Expensing in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to increase the dollar limitation permanently to $100,000 and the threshold for reduction to $500,000. Inflation adjustments have also been made to the dollar limitation. The Section 179 Expensing in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to increase the dollar limitation to $100,000 for taxable years after 2005, with a cost-of-living adjustment. Additionally, the phaseout amount for taxable years after 2006 has been increased to $500,000. The dollar amount for Section 179 Expensing is increased to $100,000 for taxable years after 2005, with a cost-of-living adjustment. Amounts are rounded to the nearest multiple of $1,000 and $10,000 for dollar limitation and phaseout amount, respectively. The amendments made by this subsection apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2005. Section 38(c)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow the Work Opportunity Credit, Welfare-to-Work Credit, and Research Credit against Alternative Minimum Tax. The amendments made by this subsection apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2005, affecting the credit determined under section 41. SEC. 2. STANDARD HOME OFFICE DEDUCTION. The amendment allows for a standard home office deduction of $2,500 for taxpayers who elect to apply it for certain uses of their dwelling unit as a residence. No other deductions are allowed for such use under the Internal Revenue Code. The amendment allows for a standard home office deduction of $2,500 for certain uses of a dwelling unit as a residence, with no other deductions allowed. The amendment applies to taxable years beginning after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. MINIMUM WAGE PROVISIONS. Exemption for Small Employers: Amendments to the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 exempt employers with ten or more employees. Effective date for the amendments is October 1, 2006. Phased Increase in minimum wage to $5.50 an hour by September 30, 2006. The minimum wage will be $5.50 an hour starting October 1, 2006, increasing to $6.00 an hour in 2007, and $6.50 an hour in 2008. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to increase the exemption for annual gross volume of sales made by an enterprise, with specific thresholds set for taxable years ending before and after October 1, 2006. SEC. 5. EARNED INCOME EXCLUSION UNDER THE SSI PROGRAM. Section 1612(b) of the Social Security Act is amended to include provisions for individuals without eligible spouses and those with eligible spouses regarding the minimum wage rate and earned income exclusion under the SSI program. The amendments to Section 1612(b) of the Social Security Act include provisions for individuals with eligible spouses regarding the minimum wage rate and earned income exclusion under the SSI program, effective October 1, 2006.
